poem:
### A Morning Headline

The gavel echoes through the grand Paris halls,  
where ambition and justice meet in a contentious dance—  
a five-year promise to paint her sidelines grey,  
while chameleons scurry under the EU sun,  
jostling for their share of shadow and light;  
as we sip our morning coffee,  
the headlines shift like dreams upon waking.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Paris prosecutor seeks jail and public office ban for Marine Le Pen A Paris prosecutor has requested a five-year prison sentence and a five-year ban from public office for the far-right leader Marine Le Pen, at a trial in which she and 24 others are accused of embezzling EU funds. The trial, which comes almost a decade after initial investigations started, threatens to undermine her National Rally (RN) party’s efforts to polish its image before". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Paris prosecutor seeks jail and public office ban for Marine Le Pen A Paris prosecutor has requested a five-year prison sentence and a five-year ban from public office for the far-right leader Marine Le Pen, at a trial in which she and 24 others are accused of embezzling EU funds. The trial, which comes almost a decade after initial investigations started, threatens to undermine her National Rally (RN) party’s efforts to polish its image before
